website_summaries.verdict: For those looking for a more traditional remote, this is a good option.
pros: A moderately-priced IR remote that works with the Xbox One in addition to a handful of other devices
Plenty of buttons and programming options, including a pre-programmed Xbox One setting
cons: Some customers had difficulty with the IR blaster

website_summaries.verdict: Effortlessly syncs with a wide number of devices; the best bang for your buck when it comes to universal remotes.
pros: Distances itself from competitors with its versatile setup, including pre-programming for Apple TV, Windows Media Center, and more
cons: The illumination period lasts just five seconds and can't be adjusted

website_summaries.verdict: Users like the multi-device capability and comfortable feel of this remote, especially at its price point.
pros: Very intuitive analog button placement that complements its programmable interface
Fast setup through website, mapping to multiple devices
cons: Learning mode is a little glitchy
Some users have difficulty programming the remote and its macros
May not work with older media devices
Preprinted button stickers are a pain to cut out and apply

customer_reviews.title: Product construction is great and you can configure it quite easily
customer_reviews.text: Product construction is great and you can configure it quite easily. The feature to copy a button from the training remote is great too. Even with that I am giving a one star because the remote keeps losing the setup. I have had this for about 2 months now and had to configure it twice already. It is definitely not a memory issue because it works fine about 2-3 weeks. The remote seems to be going back to factory settings after a few users. ALL configuration gets erased and is pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Great!: Replaced Sound System Remote, TV Remote, and Apple TV Remote
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to replace a sound bar remote, TV remote, and Apple TV remote. I treated it as one device and taught the remote each command one by one (took less than 10 min). Now the one remote will turn the TV on, control the sound bar and Apple TV with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Stark Review

customer_reviews.title: Totally unsuccessful remote!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote based on the reviews I read. I have found it to be a very difficult remote to use. It was difficult to program--difficult to even turn on the components. Slow to follow commands. I have struggled to use this counterintuitive remote for two months now. Probably too long to return it to the seller! But it has NEVER been successful. Do NOT buy this. Saving $10 over a similar Harmony product--"penny wise and pound foolish!"
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Success!  All devices programmed on one remote!  Need ABCD&E buttons
customer_reviews.text: I got my new Samsung TV, Sony blue ray player, Denon Receiver and Ruku all programmed on this remote in under 20 minutes. Go to remotecodes.net! Very happy, as I've failed to obtain full functionality in the past on competitor's universal remotes, but this one does it all. I have 5 devices I needed to control. Needed a 5th "E" button, but it's not a big deal to leave the Xbox off of the remote. So no need to knock off a star for that. I can't tell if there's a plastic film I need to pull off, but the shiny black area is cloudy in spots and scratches very easily.
customer_reviews.author: RSS Sief

customer_reviews.title: Does not Tune Most US Broadcast Channels
customer_reviews.text: You cannot use this remote with digital TV channels such as all the broadcast channels in the United States. There is no hyphen or period button. So for example to go to channel 50-5, you must press 50, wait for it to register, then [up arrow], [up arrow], [up arrow], [up arrow]. Pretty disappointing as we went to digital channels several years ago. This must be an inventory liquidator for an out of date product. It is confirmed in the Q&A section for this product that the seller never actually tested the product for this feature.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, cheaply built, horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Initially 5 stars. Great idea, pairing a IR Roku remote with macros to allow one remote to control TV, steaming box and sound bar. 1 star review now. After less then 2 years of use the remote is useless. The build quality is crap. The most used buttons steadily require you to push harder and harder until they become unusable. And when I contacted the seller, they responded with a extremely condescending email.
customer_reviews.author: Dezracer

customer_reviews.title: Completely stopped functioning after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for nearly two months then it just stopped functioning last week. The lights come on so it has power but will not control anything. I did a factory reset and even the pre programmed settings no longer functions. Kept trying to re program it but nothing responds. It's like the IR is broken. Very frustrating considering this is a $30 remote and I bought two of them.
customer_reviews.author: JonBoyWhite

customer_reviews.title: A little complicated to program, but very capable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to run 4 devices. It takes some time to read through the directions and program everything correctly, but it's well worth the effort. There's a lot of flexibility in programming keys and setting up macros so that you can turn on/off the TV with one button and avoid conflicts between the volume and channel controls among the different devices. The responsiveness of the buttons are great too, so you can flip through your channels really quick. I like it a lot better than the much more expensive Logitech remote I had earlier.
customer_reviews.author: jimmunology

customer_reviews.title: Does not function with Apple TV
customer_reviews.text: Despite saying it will, this remote will not function with the 4G Apple TV. There is no function to navigate through menu items, moving right, left, up or down... It receives the IR input as the light on the front of the Apple TV flashes but nothing happens..... I'm disappointed as I am not a fan of the remote that comes with Apple tv It also did not hold the programming of the TV overnight. I had to turn it on with the original remote.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my kids lost our Apple remote. I thought it would help to have Apple, Amazon, TV, and soundbar all on one remote. I was able to use it for Apple, but it does not control all the features and it is very difficult to figure out. You have to have a special connector to make it work with Amazon. So basically, I can control the TV with it, turn the volume up and down on the soundbar, and barely navigate on Apple. It was a waste of money. I really wanted to like it, but it just doesn't do what we need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: SanityEludesMe

customer_reviews.title: Good price, nice features, controls DirecTV Genie
customer_reviews.text: Great remote. I've been searching for an easy to use (and inexpensive) backlit learning remote to use with my DirecTV Genie and Vizio smart tv...this one fits the bill. Works great with the codes that are accessible online, including my DirecTV Genie HR44-200. I did have to customize some keys, as some specific function keys on the DirecTV remote and Vizio remote were not present on the INT422-3, but it was simple to do. Don't know yet how durable the unit will be, but the keys are a good size over all, and of course the backlight is great. So far, I recommend this remote if you're looking to control DirecTV box and smart tv, etc.
customer_reviews.author: jmco

customer_reviews.title: 4 Year lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these remotes in 2015. The first one failed last month. I tried to figure it out myself, but was unable to get the remote to function. I tried the original remotes to my devices, and they worked fine. Definitely a problem with this remote. I hoped it was an isolated issue and bought another. Just today my second remote from 2015 failed. I will be finding an alternative remote. The tech support on Inteset's site is abysmal. If I had not had these issues this would be a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: I am still shocked
customer_reviews.text: This remote works so so very well, I had my doubts. It came with batteries and I installed and went to the website they give you, set up my different devices and it works perfectly. I needed my TV, XBOXONE, DirecTV box and my SONOS play bar to work and it worked everything ....... .!!!! The codes worked and I was able to program macros to turn on what devices and I wanted or another macro to turn on all the devices and then automatically set it to ESPN. This remote control is great, it lights up and feels good in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm A Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: Works with Apple TV 4K right out of the box!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use w/Apple TV 4K and it worked right out of the box. Have not had a chance to check on why volume buttons don't work, but will do. In the meantime, sooooo happy to have an alternative remote to use instead of the not so great remote that comes with the Apple TV. It is indeed ergonomically easy to hold and to operate. And the price is great, shipping was very quick and it comes with batteries to get you started super quick. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: DonkeySmiles

customer_reviews.title: It does more than you know
customer_reviews.text: It took a while for me to figure it out. But when I did, I discovered that I am very happy with this product. There are three important thing that you may miss: 1) Program the "D" key as your Roku. That way, you can used the colored buttons as Netflix, Youtube, Amazon and Pandora shortcuts. It's incredibly convenient. 2) Use the Learning Mode to program your buttons. It was greatly helpful for programming my Bose GSX system. I used this to program the various sources (TV, Aux, CD/DVD, Cable/SAT). 3) I have a Comcast cable box. The colored keys do magic things like switch to Spanish language.
customer_reviews.author: tinyfistsoffury

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote to control my TV, FireTV cube and soundbar. The selling point was its learning ability and backlighting which I wanted for the bedroom TV. Overall, the quality is disappointing as the buttons are soft and slow to respond when pressed. The back-lit barely stays on for 1-2 seconds and the worst part, it simply stopped controlling the soundbar. It was working fine for 3 months and allowed me to turn all all devices with a single button power press, but now, without any changes to the settings, it no longer turns on/off the soundbar. I'm sure I can re-program it again, but that is not the point. Overall, disappointing. Will be looking for a better replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Rommel

customer_reviews.title: Inteset INT-422 4-in-1 Universal Backlit IR Learning Remote
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Inteset remote I have purchased over the years and they work wonderfully. All buttons are back lit with a soft orange glow when you press any one of them. The unit is a 4-in-1 remote and is easily programmed using codes for your device provided by the manufacturer however, I do suggest looking on their site for codes as it is updated as new devices hit the market. The remote does come with 2 batteries, code book with instructions how to program your remote, and custom stickers for labeling your buttons. It does have a nice solid feel not just cheap plastic that's going to break easily.
customer_reviews.author: FredSanchez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Program and Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: So far, we love it. It's programmable and not finicky like our now-dead Logitech Harmony. It doesn't need constant charging and the buttons seem to be placed correctly for our hands. Gonna buy another one for the living room setup. The Logitech was such a pain in the butt to program and every time there was a glitch, I had to reload the programming, remember my password, and generally cuss up a storm. Back to the simpler life. Took a while to find the correct code for the Comcrap dvr box but after that, things went smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: B.O.B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, until it stopped
customer_reviews.text: The remote worked well when we programmed our LG TV, Yamaha sound bar and Apple TV. It worked for about 1 month then totally stopped working. Normally you touch any button and it lights up. The remote is now totally unresponsive. We’ve changed the batteries. It worked the night before, turned it off and the next day the remote was unresponsive. It doesn’t appear damaged or have loose internals, not sure why it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Interesting concept
customer_reviews.text: Read the instructions and be clear on modes before trying to do anything else. Universal remote controls is an area no one can perfect. The URC paradox: the easier they make programming it the more complicated it becomes! This takes a different approach than Logitech Harmony. To do macros you enter a code which says “here comes a macro” then enter button pushes for the sequence of commands. This remote is laid out very differently than usual as it calls itself a streaming remote. It still has a ton of buttons, and I’m liking the bare bones almost buttonless voice remotes of Samsung, Amazon Fire and Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Void

customer_reviews.title: Limited functionality with Fire Tv
customer_reviews.text: If you are planning on using this remote with either a fire tv or fire tv stick I would suggest finding an alternative. The issue is that every app seems to have a different button configuration. For example, while the back button works as it should for most apps, I have not found any button on this remote to perform the back command within Hulu. Also, the play button does not work as it should when fast forwarding in the Directvnow app. This remote has worked for an Apple Tv and on my XBOX, but for the fire tv family of devices there is definitely some work to be done.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Good remote, but not as functional as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good remote,but not as functional as advertised. It does not have a legit "back" button. I mean it has an exit button,but no back button. Pretty annoying on Hulu,Netflix,ECT when you hit the button and it takes you back out of the app completely. Tried the learning feature and still no avail.
customer_reviews.author: James Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Great remote and easy to code
customer_reviews.text: It lets me control my TV, soundbar, and Xbox One and that's what I's appreciates abouts it. Sorry, I've been watching a lot of Letter Kenny. But this remote is awesome and the backlight is really helpful at night. My new dog chewed up every remote in the house and being able buy one remote to replace them made the whole situation sting a bit less. Plus every product I paired worked with the first code!
customer_reviews.author: Team JaKa!!!

customer_reviews.title: It works real well with my Xbox One S
customer_reviews.text: I got this remote to replace the media remote that I use to watch OTA TV on my Xbox One S. The other unit still works, but the number pad is hard to see in low light, even though it's got backlight buttons. This remote was already set to work with my Xbox, although many functions are not marked, so it took some trail and error. While the number buttons on this remote are easier to read than my old unit, it's too bad it doesn't come in white, as I'd prefer white background with black numbers over black background with white numbers. Overall, we're happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: The remote is great. I purchased it to handle my TV, sound bar and new Xbox One X. The Xbox One X is such a nice piece of hardware that it did a perfect job of doubling as a media device for our TV. The remote was easy to setup, the learning curve was easy for my wife, and it just works. Now we're able to handle all three devices with one remote and have a much more enjoyable media experience. This remote brought it all together which makes for a very pleasant media experience. Great job and I highly recommend if you're looking for a solution at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Engineering degree not needed.
customer_reviews.text: Paid for a Harmony Logitech remote and spent 2 hours (mostly because I'm not super tech savvy) trying to set it up. Purchased the Inteset INT 422 and it was exactly what the doctor ordered. Xbox One was already pre-programmed and setting up my TV and sound bar took literally 3 minutes. Contemplating purchasing a 2nd one for my bedroom. Harmony remote was 150 bucks and this was 25. Going back to best buy tomorrow to return the behemoth. Only negative is that it's not as flashy as the higher end remotes but it's beautiful to me when all factors are considered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for cord cutters
customer_reviews.text: I got to a point where cable TV was more than I was willing to pay and decided to cut the cord, using the Roku as my device of choice. Been using this for a week now and it is working quite well. Took about 30 seconds to get paired with my TV. Going through other options I set the volume controls to stay locked to the TV, and I set up a macro on the power button so when I turn off the TV it also sends the Roku back to the home screen so it stops streaming. Will probably be making a few more tweaks here and there, very happy with this remote so far.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Can't keep the devices programmed
customer_reviews.text: This remote did not work well for me. I had to reset and reprogram it every day. It would no longer control the devices. Sometimes it would lose the device control from one on/off cycle to another. While learning the device and remote, too many keys from the original remote were not available on this one. Also, I have the Apple TV HD with the touch screen remote. This remote did not manage the apple tv very well. I returned this one and one try one other one. If no success, I'll go back to using at least four remotes.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Watson

customer_reviews.title: If you have a lot of technology but need one remote.  This is for you!
customer_reviews.text: I have two TVs in my living room. One is hooked to a Roku, the other one has the Xbox 1 hooked up to it. I use this remote to control everything. Switching between inputs on the remote lets me control everything from my wall mounted fire place to the Roku, to the xbox, to each TV itself, the audio bar, etc. It really does wonders. The smart learning technology lets you program any remote with IR. Which is insane! I have a special programmed button that I use to turn on my wall mounted fireplace and then can use another button to turn the heat up, etc. I hate having three remotes laying around and this solved all that.
customer_reviews.author: Pip Lowback

customer_reviews.title: manual sucks, find your own remote codes
customer_reviews.text: the part where they list remote codes is a link to a dead website. learning ir signals from a parent remote (the orignal) of the device is a bit janky. it works but after it blinks twice and is programmed it downt exit programing untill you pull the battery and out it back in. it would learn to repeat the home button multiple times because i thought it didnt take. had to remove the programing and program it again. works great now, the manual needs a rewrite badly. besides that it works great and is easy enough to learn
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic remote
customer_reviews.text: This is a great remote! It was easy to program, easy to learn and the buttons are easy to the touch. If I had one complaint, it would be the labels. The labels are, probably, more for Play Stations, Xboxes or for streaming services, but not so much for the average TV users. It had a bunch of labels that wouldn't deal with DVRs or TVs, but still, a great remote. Some label suggestions would be "Day"; Up, Down, Left and Right "Arrows", etc. I use this remote to replace the Spectrum DVR remote because I couldn't control my sound bar and control my Apple TV. If you're looking for a multi-device remote, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: pakreb

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Great remote. Can learn just about anything. I have a sound bar that won't work with regular learning remotes, but I can program this one by just pointing the remotes at each other and learn the relevant button presses. I also setup a macro to turn on all of my devices at once. The button layout isn't as intuitive as I'd like, but again, you can reprogram almost anything on here. If all else fails, there is a JP1 connector in the battery area for advanced pc programming (way too advanced for me or most people, but always an option).
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great All Around Remote
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this remote for use with my X-Box One console and associated audio equipment (Onkyo receiver, Verizon cable box, LG TV) This remote performed 100 times better than the official X-Box remote with much greater range and accuracy. Some people expressed concern regarding the accuracy and effectiveness of the volume control which under the normal setting doesn't work well. What I found as a great work around is to simply use the learning function to teach the Inteset remote your media control volume button. This will then allow the remote to use the IR for your media receiver instead of X-Box One Kinect as a receiver which will give you greater accuracy and range when adjusting the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Gee D'Man

customer_reviews.title: Not a replacement for Fire TV Remote
customer_reviews.text: The expectations of this as a fire TV remote is not the same as a fire TV remote. You have to figure out the buttons, they are not marked on the remote and in some random order. If you have your firestick connected with the ethernet adapter DO NOT BUY THIS. It will not work if the adapter is attached. There is not scroll or page up page down. Only channel up and down so you will lose that function if you have it on your other remote. 2 stars because it did connect to the TV and was already connected and worked well with the Xbox.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Davis

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok for what it is but not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: It’s an ok remote although I just purchased a (SofaBaton) and wish I hadn’t wasted money on this one it’s ok for someone with basic control needs for an older 2018 or later TV and maybe a DVD player but if you need it for other things it may not work to your full expectations and if your tv is new it may not have the right codes like my newer model 4K TV the SofaBaton on the other hand was the easiest thing to program these people could learn a thing or two about making a better remote from them.
customer_reviews.author: K.H. Dutchington

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect remote...missing one thing...
customer_reviews.text: Love this remote but wish it had one new feature. I love the Volume Lock so the volume commands always go to my sound bar. But I wish there was a “All Off” lock feature where, if I activate that feature then whenever I hit the power button it sends the power on/off toggle to all four of my programmed inputs A, B, C, D so that everything goes on and off at once instead of having to pick a source and individually turning it on and off. Other than missing this feature, I love this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Kearney

customer_reviews.title: Works for my old and new devices
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I have a collection of old and new devices and too many remotes in the living room. Most of the devices worked perfectly using the codes supplied by the manufacturer. I had to program a couple keys manually using the "learning" function and in each case it works properly. About the only thing that it doesn't have is a "-" button for entering a sub-channel for OTA TV broadcasts. I re-programmed one of the other keys to do this function so that is not a problem. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: This remote has been an excellent purchase. My only relatively minor knocks would be ...
customer_reviews.text: This remote has been an excellent purchase. My only relatively minor knocks would be the key logicality and size and feel seems a bit awkward to use (particularly with Netflix). Also; and, I know this is probably on me, I still haven't found the codes for the DTV genie remotes. That aside, I doubt you will find a better 4 device remote for this price. If you are wondering whether or not it really works with Netflix, Amazon, etc. I can tell you it does flawlessly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and programming
customer_reviews.text: I love having one remote for all my devices and this certainly does that. I have never liked the remote for the Apple TV (I find it too touchy). This works perfectly. The first thing I like is that it is preset to Apple TV. setting to my tv was simple, just follow the code guidelines on the website. I see that some people have had problems with it loosing the codes after a few months, that hasn’t happened yet. If and when it does, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Rvickroy

customer_reviews.title: Almost 2 years old and going strong
customer_reviews.text: This is my first universal remote, and I'm pleasantly surprised how awesome it is for the money. I purchased mine October 2018, and it's still going strong. I've only had to replace the batteries once. I've programmed the tv, backlight strips, audio receiver, and A/C to use this remote. It could be easier to program stuff, but having to reference the manual makes it not too big of a deal for me, it's not that hard. I love the backlit feature, big props for that.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Literal best remote for XB1!
customer_reviews.text: We had originally purchased a smaller remote for the xbox when I stopped playing games so much and it became more of our media hub. It was so much easier to control Netflix and other video with a remote vs the controller, but then we still had like five remotes. TV, amp, xbox, cable box, Firestick, etc. So I started hunting for a universal remote that could handle all those imputs. This one by far takes the cake. It was SUPER easy to program, and now we have ONE remote to control EVERYTHING and it is amazing. Seriously, it's so freeing. Stop thinking about it and just buy this. It'll make your life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: lenthatswho

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not exactly as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a TCL Roku smart TV, because I had hoped it would let me pick the channel on the Spectrum app via the numeric keypad. That doesn't seem to be possible. I give it 4 stars, it works like the remote that came with the TV, and it's well constructed. The problem is the TV, not the remote. I'll just have to hold channel up or channel down to go from 12 to 314, sigh.
customer_reviews.author: MarkD

customer_reviews.title: Good remote, better than expensive Harmony, trouble programming
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Harmony hub with this because i was tired of having to sync everyday. I thought I had found the solution for my FireTv and all of my devices. Overall a good remote with backlit and programmable buttons, however, I had two problems. I could not get the FireTV code to work - which was a big problem and because you have to use a receiver, you need a splitter. Using a splitter caused a picture distortion because the firetv was not directly connected to the TV. So I am back to the plain FireTV remotes, hope Amazon decides to upgrade one day.
customer_reviews.author: TamiJ

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, so easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this would be difficult to setup. I was a little skeptical of it working with my Nvidia Shield but all I had to do is enter one code and it worked perfectly with my shield. I assumed I would need the IR attachment but I guess my Shield has IR built in. I have the older model of the shield so wasn't sure. I'll be returning the IR attachment I purchased separately but only because I didn't need it. I would definitely recommend this remote to anyone with a streaming device hooked up to their TV. Finally I don't need to juggle remotes.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Not easy!
customer_reviews.text: Got it programmed with quite a bit of work. Unfortunately while this remote calls itself universal bc it puts all components on one remote it is NOT what I am use to. I expect to press one button for TV, Receiver and Cable and be able to control volume. With this remote you have to press receiver button for volume, them cable button for list of your shows and it goes on and on. DVD player same problem. Ugh! 😑 Needless to say there is no relaxing when watching TV with this remote. I gave it 3 ⭐️ because it is solid, sturdy remote that got great in your hand. Feels like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: tmc64

customer_reviews.title: Was NOT happy at first.
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble at first getting this remote programed to my TV. The directions are NOT good at directing you to the tv codes needed to get the job done. I was going to the Vizio web site to get codes and found out later from the remote seller that I needed to go to their web site for their codes. First code I used from them worked great. Seller needs to make their directions for remote setup more idiot proof, or more clearly directing you to your device codes.
customer_reviews.author: Mac & Mar

customer_reviews.title: Works w/ Roku Premiere+ & Charter-Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: Excellent.. easily set it up with my new Samsung UHD TV, Roku Premiere+, and Charter Spectrum cable box. Words to the wise : If you are programming the same units as described.. Roku Premiere+ requires line-of-sight for infrared operation unlike the RF remote it comes with. If you have Charter-Spectrum and have a "technicolor" brand cable box, use the remote code for Cisco as they are manufacturer of that box. The "technicolor" remote code will not work. Illumination is great for night time TV. Going to buy another for my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Bill

customer_reviews.title: Very good remote
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, good button feel, very configurable (lock volume button to one device, program macros etc.). A couple of complaints, stickers are only cut vertically so you have to cut them to size yourself and I haven't found a good code for my Onkyo receiver that gives me both power AND menu selection, its either or! I can probably teach it those codes but it isn't pressing. Also, as seems common, doesn't seem to have a good way of going back on a Samsung TV, just exits the menu altogether.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great remote. I can control my Sony TV, Pioneer Receiver, AppleTV, AndroidBox and fan. I could not figure out how to use the volume buttons when I am using the AppleTV with AirPods. You will have to open the AppleTV app on your iPhone then press the side volume buttons of your iPhone or the original AppleTV’s remote. Cons: I wish this remote was better designed. The directional buttons should be on the button of the remote not on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Fora Leco

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this remote for just over a month and though it’s a great remote, the past few weeks some of the buttons have been sticking and I’m afraid it’ll continue to worsen. I have an Apple TV 4K and it works fantastic with it, which was the main reason I purchased this remote. It was easy to connect it to my tv, my sound bar, and my Apple TV. If the buttons didn’t stick this remote would be 5 stars. As of now, I would consider this remote to still be new and I’ll update my review if anything else happens as the months go by.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as states- Customer Service Horrible
customer_reviews.text: After doing extensive research looking for a remote that would work with all of my systems I settled on this one. Big mistake. Nothing works as stated and when I contacted customer service all I got was a canned response and no help at all and after many attempts to contact them I finally gave up and returned it. Do yourself a favor and skip this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still requires other remotes
customer_reviews.text: While this remote looks and seems to be well constructed it can't perform all the functions of my TV, Roku, and Direct TV remote thus making me keep all of them on my side table. That being the case, sending this back as I did cleared some space on my table and also got rid of an annoying button problem. Whenever I clicked an arrow it would move two or three times rather than just once. Price was great considering Logitech but not worth the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: JTown

customer_reviews.title: Best universal non American remote I have used to date
customer_reviews.text: Best universal non American remote I have used to date. Ok that was a bad joke. But seriously, I bought a second one for downstairs. This thing does it all and offers enough programmability but not to the point you need an engineering degree to operate it. Had my first one for over a year to this point with nothing bad to say about it. Still on the first set of batteries. Don't waste your money buying an expensive harmony or other universal remote. This one will do it all and do it well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Works with my XBOX ONE, Apple TV and my audio receiver
customer_reviews.text: Works with my XBOX ONE, Apple TV and my audio receiver. I haven't figured out the code for my Epson 2040. The Epson takes two button presses so I don't know if it would turn on/off with all components set up to do so. Setup takes a little time but once it's working it works fine. I press power and all my components I set up turn on/off. I can control the volume on my audio receiver without pressing a component key.
customer_reviews.author: chef doeuvre

customer_reviews.title: Does What It Says It Will
customer_reviews.text: If you are careful about learning how to program this unit, it delivers. It's not going to be the solution for everybody because not everybody will have the patience and capacity to get the commands just right. My case was, cable and Blu-Ray go into receiver, which then controls all audio to a 5.1 arrangement, and sends video to a TV where audio is disabled. At the end of the day, I use this remote only for the receiver, Blu-Ray, and TV, and I also still need the Comcast remote because it runs off RF not IR. So, 2 remotes instead of 4.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Little Memory - Ok button no longer works
customer_reviews.text: Having very little memory ruins an otherwise great remote. It can only learn a handful of buttons before running out of memory. As cheap as memory is anymore, there is just no excuse for this. Update: minus another star. A little less than 2 years and the Ok button does not work making it essentially worthless. Granted it is the most used button, and there is an easy fix on most remotes - you just clean the circuit board (an eraser actually works good for this). However, this remote was so cheaply put together that you can't possibly take it apart with out destroying it. Seriously, how much does a couple screws cost?
customer_reviews.author: Super D

customer_reviews.title: Lots of codes, just not the right ones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote to simplify my remote situation. I have a soundbar (vizo), flat screen TV (Sony), Kenwood receiver and a Roku Plus. While my TV and Sound Bar were controllable the codes for my Kenwood Amplifier were missing, additionally my Roku does not use Radio signals so it was not compatible. Someone from Customer Support had some suggestions about using my old remotes to learn codes but I am missing one of the remotes. There is always an exception to the rules. I try to buy a more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hoven

customer_reviews.title: First remote that does it all!
customer_reviews.text: Finally I have a remote that will do everything. I have a Roku 4k, Sony Blu Ray and Bose Sound bar. I can now control all with the same controller. What was not covered it the standard set up I was able to program. TV Line in, Bose volume control with the Roku, eject the Blu Ray disk. I have the Harmony and found it to be way to complicated to use and program. Very impressed. Wished I had the 8 controller so I could do the Stereo sound system. Very easy to use and set up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Oct 14, it's now Dec 14 and it just died for good. Prior to its final demise, the remote would forget its programming once in a while. Then, some of the devices wouldn't control the receiver's volume. So I reset it to factory settings and reprogrammed it without using the volume punch-through feature. All seemed well until today when it finally croaked. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewerman

customer_reviews.title: Great remote at a low price
customer_reviews.text: This remote does a lot for the cost... which is a good thing as it seems to be my dogs favorite chew toy. I am now ordering remote #3. The remote is easy to setup (especially when you done it more than once) and I like the ability to program multiple button presses on one button and lock the volume to one device while controlling another (good for use with my speaker bar). Now if I could just get my kids to stop leaving it out for the dog....
customer_reviews.author: IrishPuterGeek

customer_reviews.title: Fast, and easy and functions well.
customer_reviews.text: Functions exactly as it claims. However I gave it five stars because of how easy it is to set up, and the fact that it costs a fraction of the price of some other "premium" controllers. This is better than any other controller I've used. The last universal controller I tried cost ten times as much, and I returned it because after trying to configure it with its clunky app and trying to manually set it up by plugging it into my computer it could not recognize my sound bar. The Inset 4-in-1 recognized it in moments.
customer_reviews.author: STEVED72

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly quick and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a remote to control my rif6 soundbar with tv, Verizon, and a/b switcher. I set this up in under 15 minutes including learning a remote and assigning Macros. I’ve never had an experience that worked this right the first time. This was complicated and perfect. I had purchased another remote for $10 that was supposed to be universal but that one wasn’t. This Is worth the money for this unless you like aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: CBR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Product is super. Good material and finish. CONS: 1. Programming instructions are not very good. Doesn't really tell you when to let go of the buttons while programming. Took multiple tries to get it working. Volume lock is good function which allows to control the TV volume while the remote is being used to control another video source - like SAT/STB/BLURAY etc... 2. Also would like to turn the back light off. Waste of battery power.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Works with Apple TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a hopeful replacement for that asinine Apple TV touch remote. And, to my surprise, it did indeed replace it. Works like any TV/DVD/Satellite remote, but without a touch input that is so frustrating. It has a single button setup for Apple TV that takes about 1 second (The blank red button) and then is ready to go. It doesn't have to call home, like some others that want your viewing data. Had it not worked, I would have dumped the ATV and replaced it with a Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough as universal remote, poor backlight
customer_reviews.text: I don’t care for the backlight feature on this, which is the reason I bought this particular remote. I have a remote with a backlight I loved but my grand daughter broke it. And they no longer make it. This is the closest I could find to replace it. But there is no button to press if you simply want to see all the keys when watching tv in the dark. My old one had one at the bottom. So I am constantly accidentally turning the tv off or something since I can’t actually see what button I am pressing until I press it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Uselewss without device codes
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with the looks of the remote, BUT the website to get device codes is gone. I tried the long way to find the codes (turn it on and keep pressing buttons until it goes off) but it did not find the correct codes. Something should be done to the seller who has to know they are selling a non fuctioning remote. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Marc Williams

customer_reviews.title: Remote is okay - did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I tested this remote setup and had to return it back. Two issues 1) In an age of youtube videos, this product did not have a good user guide. Setup was difficult. I had to write to their help desk (Great guy, extremely helpful..!) and their user forum 2) Main problem - controlling multiple devices in sequence (like a Harmony remote). Unfortunately, I wasn't able to make it work. I think the remote is good for something basic I was happy with what remote has to offer - only it did not work for me. Hence 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: SreeK

customer_reviews.title: Works but somewhat annoying
customer_reviews.text: We have a Sony TV, Sony receiver, Roku Ultra, and a Cox cable box. It works but requires a lot of setup. We still can't figure out how to switch the inputs to the TV w/o using the TV's remote. Also, the remote has a very limited angle of operation. It has to be pointed at a very particular spot to operate devices whereas the cable box remote is far less picky. We will keep it as a backup but it is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Cognizant Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Very capable remote control did everything I needed and did it well.
customer_reviews.text: Though it can only handle four devices, it can learn from other remotes so it can control more than four devices since they don't all need all of the buttons. It learned commands from my other remotes, let me use the amp volume on all the devices, and add on and off commands to other buttons. The shape is good, it is light, and the price is right. I like it even better than my more expensive (but older) programmable remote.
customer_reviews.author: Backroad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to program, useful presets, good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought primarily to use as a media control for Xbox One S, which worked out of the box. I programmed it for my Denon receiver and LG TV, so now I don't need those other remotes for normal use. Easy to customize behavior of the remote, learning feature works easily. Has macros but I haven't tried that. Nice backlit buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Universal Remote - great for MCE & XBMC/KODI.
customer_reviews.text: Massively better remote to replace the POS MCE remotes. All the flimsy MCE remotes break within a few months of use. This one's been holding up for well over a year of constant use. It does lack a couple of MCE default buttons (but rearly used), but you can either program those features back in, or work around it. One such button/feature is closed captioning. Its easy to get around this. Solidly built. The back lighting is terrific in a dark room. The main buttons are pleasing and comfortable size and respond well. The unit balances well in the hand and is comfortable to hold.
customer_reviews.author: xoraclez

customer_reviews.title: Basic remote but very functional
customer_reviews.text: This isn't one of the higher end remotes that can be programmed over the web but it a solid low-cost alternative for those who need a programmable remote that works with a vast number of devices. The "learning mode" works without fail and helps to make this a very functional and practical remote for those looking for an alternative to the smart remotes that are on the market. I would buy this again without hesitation and plan to do for one of the other TVs in my household.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomically and easy to operate in one hand + has all the features
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is to be able to set the back light permanently for 10 seconds or a separate button on the side to turn the light on and off, without a timer and the ability to have a 5th device. Otherwise this is great and as advertised. It fits well in one hand and does most everything you would want. Only real limitation is that it is for 4 devices. A 5th would be good as there is SAT, TV, Blu-ray, Receiver and now Apple TV, so I have to give up one device on the remote that will be the blu-ray.
customer_reviews.author: QualityReviewer2009

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, works
customer_reviews.text: This is the first remote I have tried that had a code for our bedroom TV! We use Roku, DVD, and the TV, so all I have tried is the pre-programmed Roku, and TV Works fine. The instructions were easy to follow, and worked - no flakiness that I have seen with other universal remotes. Got it for the learning function because I hadn't seen a remote that worked with the TV, but this one does, so I haven't tried learning. Everything else worked just the way it was described.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I have a Harmony remote and it does things that I could not get the Harmony to do consistently. It works perfectly with my TV, cable box, Roku box, and soundbar. setting up the macro commands is easy once you get the hang of it, which does not take long. It also seems to be sturdier than my Harmony, which is wearing out after a year, and it is a quarter of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Useless right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Useless right out of the box. Doesn't work with Apple TV 4th gen (supposedly pre-programmed but even after setting for device code 02615), doesn't work with TCL TV (supposedly device code 10885) and doesn't work with Onkyo receiver (supposedly device code 32878). Since most people seem to love it so much, I can only assume that the IR on this one is kaput.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scalo

customer_reviews.title: Died twice in two years. Giving up on Inteset.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the simplicity of this remote but it died after a year of normal use. I worked with the manufacturer to get a relacement; it took a few emails and I had to send the original one back, which was a hassle, but eventually they sent a replacement. A year later it died (again). Not a dead battery issue or user error. Just completely unresponsive. I have questions about Inteset's build quality, since we have remotes that have lasted decades and this one can't last more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up
customer_reviews.text: LG oled 55 inch, Sony receiver, Samsung blu-ray disk player, and DirecTV box....It took about twenty minutes to set them up. I haven't yet set up macros, but the included instructions look obvious to implement. Additional information: Check what every button does on each of the four functions before trying to manually add a function you think isn't there....you may find the function in a place that isn't intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Labyrinth

customer_reviews.title: Simple to program and use
customer_reviews.text: So far so good although I need a bit more time to figure out how to reprogram one of the buttons for Sling. None of the directions I could find tell you how to reprogram the ones that are preset for Amazon, YouTube and Pandora (the color buttons). And it works like a charm for Roku although a bit slow sometimes but might be user error/learning curve. This is perfect as we just wanted for TV and Roku and weren't really concerned with adding the blue-ray and all that since we are lazy and don't use them as much. Oh and the backlight when you press the buttons is really a great feature...especially for those of us with older eyes!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding?
customer_reviews.text: I must be missing something here. Ordered by the reviews, but the instructions and the website were confusing. Not clear how many digits the device codes had to be, but the website was strange as it was. My devices had many different codes, and it would take a lot of time to even figure out which one worked. Give me the Logitech online programming. I just ordered my third 650 despite the button failures. The expensive remotes just didn't cut it review-wise.
customer_reviews.author: RWinAZ

customer_reviews.title: Good Remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote works well. Easy to set up. Takes a little bit of time to remember which buttons do what. (Ex: the "info" button on the Inteset remote is used in place of the * asterisk button on Roku remote) The stickers are difficult to cut and apply. You'll need tweezers. I've had the remote for a few months and just needed to switch out the batteries last week. Unsure if that's normal for universal remote.
customer_reviews.author: Shimdim

customer_reviews.title: Takes All the Fun Out
customer_reviews.text: This is for nVidia Shield. The remote is very clunky. Yes it does work, but it is no fun. Tou must press the buttons down SO firmly to get them to work, that it takes all the fun out of this marvelous streaming technology brings. My wife complained about the nVidia remote, but she still prefers it over the new Inteset remote with the IR receiver. I should return it... but I threw away the box.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work with Fire TV's
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to work with our Fire TV and Roku. Worked with the Roku fine but we couldn't pair it with the tv. After chatting online with an Amazon rep, we were told this does NOT work with Fire TV. It would have been helpful if this had been stated in the product description.
customer_reviews.author: GA Girl

customer_reviews.title: MAYBE IT'S ME......
customer_reviews.text: I finally CUT THE CORD and bought a really good streaming device to continue to watch my favorite tv shows. I hoped that this remote would take the place of the ridiculously small remote that came with the device. MAYBE IT'S ME, but I was not able to pair the two even though the device was listed as one that was compatible. very frustrating to say the least. But again I say, MAYBE IT'S ME....
customer_reviews.author: Pcblackb from Houston

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the only "universal remote" out there that is ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the only "universal remote" out there that is inexpensive, simple to use, doesn't have its own silly little screen, can learn from other remotes, has a huge database of product codes, can record macros, and has some extra buttons at the bottom that you can assign macros to. Two minor drawbacks: it can only be used for 4 devices max (having 6 or more devices in a home theater setup is not uncommon anymore), and the stickers you can use to identify devices are super teeny-tiny. None of these drawbacks take away from the 5-starness of this.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Ernst

customer_reviews.title: 1 year on, very good.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, easy to use, both the codes for common products or using the learning feature (that I had to do for my 20+ year old amp) worked as expected. The macro feature is also easy to use and works very well. Been dropped a new times and still going strong. This review is for the Inteset 4-in-1 Universal Backlit IR Learning Remote and will work with any IR device (not RF).
customer_reviews.author: Ford Prefect

customer_reviews.title: For Universal with Roku Ultra This is it.
customer_reviews.text: Quality of this product is very good. VERY easy to setup and came pre-programmed with Roku (I have the Roku Ultra) and it works well. Took me less than 5 minutes to setup all my devices. Sat down with my wife and we agreed, this was a great purchase. Went from 3 remotes to 1 at a very affordable price. Buttons are easy to press and very responsive. We are very please with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dark when not lite
customer_reviews.text: At night you must push a button to light it up so you can use it in a semi darkened room. The button numbers are black so their is no definition when looking at the remote in a darken room. This remote should be touch sensitive and light up. Needless to say I purchased a new Verizon remote and switch to my other remote when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Slide

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! The macros are awesome! Works perfectly with my old Magnavox flatscreen, a lot better than the last universal remote I bought. I can access all the menus! In one button it turns on my TV and changes my Apple TV to Netflix... Another button will switch my TV input and turn on my Xbox. The only thing, I wish there was a pause button when performing macros to create longer chain commands without having to fill the space with unneeded button pressing. I’d also love a keyboard and a voice command, but heck for the price this thing rocks!!! Purchase with confidence :)
customer_reviews.author: jsoulful

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Remote
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 4 remotes for me, so I'm very happy. The IR button learning is excellent, was able to sync it to my Klipsch soundbar without issue using the Klipsch remote. Also makes it easy to add functions from multiple controllers to one preset, instead of having to switch around between presets for volume controls, etc. This makes using the controller a very seamless experience once everything is set up (which is also very simple). Build quality is solid, back light is fine. Overall, a very good remote for a decent price (compared to other learning remotes).
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo952

customer_reviews.title: Good universal remote control
customer_reviews.text: This is a good universal remote control. I use it with directv, AV receiver, Roku tv and fire stick 4K. It Controls all of them well. The reason for 4 stars is because for the roku remote you can’t use the * or option button with this remote and you can’t program it to it either as far as I know due to the roku remote isn’t an IR remote. If it could I would’ve given it 5 stars. I still like this remote and would recommend it to others as well.
customer_reviews.author: Slide

customer_reviews.title: I'm Impressed...
customer_reviews.text: I never heard of Inteset, but decided to try their remote due to the positve reviews. Honestly, I don't think the reviews do it justice. The remote does not feel light in weight and or feel cheap. It has a good solid feel to it. Programming was easy and it works as advertised. I had to purchase a FLIRC USB so I could use it with my Nvidia Shield 2017 (16 Gb) Streaming TV device. It's nice having one remote for my 4K TV, soundbar, and Nvidia Shield. Works great, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bum Man

customer_reviews.title: Needs a DEDICATED XBOX HOME BUTTON
customer_reviews.text: Remote works perfectly to control my TV, sound bar, and Xbox One for daily home theater needs BUT, there's no dedicated X home button like all Xbox controllers have. Closest I was able to make work was to use the DISPLAY button to bring up the menu on my Xbox, then I can navigate apps from there. If anyone has a better shortcut, please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Takuro Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Universal, and Just Plain Works! Great Remote.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement remote to control TCL Roku TV and Sound Bar. I hated using 2 remotes. I've had harmony remotes and all different all in one universal remotes but nothing was this simple to use. no complicated buttons or functions to teach other users, no activities like the harmony remotes, and nothing complicated. It is a perfect and affordable solution to all of us who just want to use one remote.
customer_reviews.author: S. Soto

customer_reviews.title: Great way to combine remotes
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to work my Insignia Fire TV and Vizio soundbar. I knew the voice control would not work but that was OK. I got the codes from online and programmed the remote in about 10 mins. The only issue I had was figuring out how the buttons were mapped. I also wanted to add a function to a button but it did not seem to work. Otherwise, great product at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple
customer_reviews.text: Great, simple, and easy remote for those who want to make the jump to streaming TV while control more conventional items like Blu Ray, etc. The remote work great for controlling a Roku premiere +, LG tv, and Blu Ray player. The macro functions are wonderful and quite easy to program.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this remote to control my TV, Sound Bar and WMC. So when I first looked at the instructions it was a little intimidating, but you know take it one step at a time :) Anyway got everything working perfectly and it really only took about 10 minutes to setup. I spent most of the time trying to fine my sound bar and ended up just learning from the sounbar remote since there are only a few functions anyway. Working great, happy to be down from 3 remotes to just 1.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: The first time the product arrived without it's original packaging and was DOA. I did a return/replacement and a new one arrived in 2-days and was properly packaged. I was quickly able to program 3-remotes ( Samsung TV, Vizio Soundbar and Cox Cable Box) and everything works perfectly. I did find that the back button used to navigate Netlix and Prime was located on the very bottom row of the remote ( the square ). So, I just moved that button to a more convenient location on the remote. Very impressed and happy to just have one remote!!
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Only party programmable, and forgets programming
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a stocking stuffer for my hubby for Xmas. It will be going back. The colored buttons are preset to Netflix, YouTube, Amazon and Pandora. No setting for Sling, can’t change the button settings, they are hard coded. I don’t care about YouTube or Pandora, I wanted to change these to Hulu and Sling. Sling has more subscribers by far than YouTube, and has a dedicated button on Roku. No * key for Roku. No search button. I guess I should’ve known better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: Great remote and easy to set up except for when I need it to learn a specific function from the original remote. Having problems setting up “back” as in one screen back. This remote has the same symbol but it returns you to the home screen instead of only one page. Also it doesn’t have a sleep button so I have to use my original remote for that as well. Last difficulty is the buttons only stay lit up for a few seconds. I’d like to extend the time frame. Overall it feels great my hand. Purchased bc I don’t watch regular tv. Instead I have Netflix, Hulu, prime, & other individual subscriptions.
customer_reviews.author: BxrWuv

product_meta.title: Inteset 4-in-1 Universal Backlit IR Learning Remote for use with Apple TV, Xbox One, Roku, Media Center/Kodi, Nvidia Shield, most Streamers and other A/V Devices
product_meta.description:
The Inteset 4-in-1 universal IR remote is designed to work with popular streaming devices such as Apple TV, Xbox One, Windows Media Center, Roku (excluding Stick) and many more. From the solid feel to the velvet coating on the back, when you hold the INT-422 remote you know it’s a high-quality product. It has most of the features found only in high-end remotes but at a fraction of the cost. Those features include volume and channel lock, macros, custom button labels, key punch-through, full backlighting and a huge built-in A/V device database. If a device is not found you can quickly program those functions with the remote’s intuitive learning capability. 

The 4 buttons at the top of the remote are pre-programmed for Apple TV (A), Xbox One (B), Media Center (C) and Roku (D) so that you can use the remote immediately with these streaming devices. You can easily assign any A/V device such as your TV or cable box to the unused device buttons or program over any of the pre-programming. Applying the included stickers above your programmed buttons helps users find the right keys effortlessly. The Red, Green, Yellow and Blue buttons function as the standard Xbox color control buttons (B, A, Y, X). For Media Center, they invoke the TV, Movies, Pictures and Video screens. For Roku, they invoke the Netflix, Amazon and other apps. You can control FireTv (excluding Stick) and the PS4 if you install a Flirc IR Receiver.

Finding the your device codes is easy using Intesets’ Device Code Lookup capability on our website. Click on the Device Type (i.e. Cable Box), select the manufacturer and then enter the device code into the remote. Then, the functionality for that device will be mapped instantly to the applicable remote buttons. Any questions are answered in our support forum, or you can contact us directly via our website. You can find our forum, contact page, device lookup, programming instructions and more at - http://www.universalremotes.net.
feature_bullets: Rugged, Commercial-Grade. Pre-programmed with Apple TV, XBox One, Media Center/Kodi and Roku device codes (excluding Roku Stick) which are easily changed. Full LED Backlighting-All buttons.

Volume Lock-The user can lock the volume in all modes; Channel Lock-The user can lock access to the channel changing capability in one mode such as the cable box; ID Lock- After a valid code has been set that code can be locked.
Macro Programming-This allows the programming of a string of commands (up to 15) within a mode or mode independent.

Device Code Database- Complete worldwide database of device codes; Library Search Capability-You can search the database for any missing codes; Learning Capability-Used to program any device that is not in the database. Go to: www.universalremotes.net.

Button Labels- These self-adhesive labels, as pictured, can be cut out and applied under the buttons that you program for your device functions; Key Punch Through-Allows the user to configure the same key function in one mode into any or all other modes; Warranty: One Year Replacement for Defects.
